content: The timed race in the vampire castle is broken. The timer gives you 35 seconds to complete but it resets when it has 18 seconds left.
Enjoying this experience much better than 90% of the experiences sold on the mobile market
Please Optimize the game for the top punch holes so itll full screen, because using Samsung's Full Screen option stretches the game and it would often crash because of that.

Wow- this came out of nowhere, and I'm glad I found it. It's a great rpg reminiscent of the best of jrpg's in their haydays. Buy it, you won't be disappointed if you like unique characters and colorful sprite work, new and old mechanics, turn based battles, exploration, upgrading and some decent writing. This is not a kemco copy and paste waste of a game and money- you'll actually enjoy this one. Should be near the top of the paid list imho...
Fun game, but I am using a Stadia controller wired to an Asus Rog Phone 3, and the character walking is very fast. It makes moving around difficult.
This game is amazing so far; great writing, enjoyable turn-based battles, awesome characters, etc.! I will definitely be looking for more titles from this developer, you all did a great job. 10/10!
I have nerve damage in my hands and can't press buttons. Love being able to play such a gorgeous game on my phone!

I love the older style rpg games. I've played every Kemco game along with FF series. The story is entertaining and dialog well written. I also enjoy finding items in nightstands or bookshelves. The enemies are visible on the map, so you can choose to fight or just go around. A hate games where every three steps is a battle. The only down side to this game is the character moves way to slow. Needs an option to walk/run.
Experiencing lag on my Umidigi A7 Pro device which runs on Android 10 and 4gb ram, please fix
Controls can be annoying. But otherwise a great game.

Just started, like 2 hrs in but looks really promising and beautiful, like your surrounding comes alive. Music is supreme love it. Also, very detailed and witty, sometimes Ara Fell is day and sometimes it's night in the start screen, first time I see something like that, very creative, all other rpgs you see the same start screen over and over again. Everybody should try it, old school like SNES but with PS1 capabilities. After 22 hrs AMAZING one of the best sound and music RPGs I have played.
Great game but I experience a lot of slowdown during extended play. Snapdragon 710 6gb ram

I'm loving it so far but I can't keep playing. I'm on Chapter 3, after you have your whole party again, and inside the ruins, there's a hallway with torches and a single door blocked with a golden lock. My character somehow passed through the torches and now I'm trapped, since I didn't get the golden key beforehand. I tried passing through the torches again but I can't and I don't have another save file. What can I do in this situation?

Beautifully made JRPG that really scratches that nostalgia itch. I recommend playing it with a bluetooth controller, but I was fine playing it with the touchscreen controls too, so it's not a must. I'm 12 hours in so far and love it! Great and natural-feeling dialogue, a fun battle system, and the crafting is a great addition to a traditional 16-bit JRPG. Honestly, for 5 bucks, this is a steal.

The controls are what you usually see in games like this, but it's fantastic with a gamepad. It looks beautiful on small displays! I should add, I'm very biased and I'm surprised I'm allowed to leave a review :)

This is a decent rpg that holds up even against the Square Enix games available on Android. An enjoyable battle engine and engaging story keeps me hooked. Reminds me of Albert Odyssey in a few ways , great artwork and nice pacing.
